newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH BANK CSOB RAISES PRIME RATE TO 25.00 PERCENT.
newsitem.headline: CZECH BANK CSOB RAISES PRIME RATE TO 25.00 PERCENT.

text.p: Czech bank Ceskoslovenska Obchodni Banka a.s. said it had raised its prime rate on Tuesday to 25.00 percent from 11.75 percent following a sharp increase in interbank rates spurred by central bank moves.
"The CSOB is continuously monitoring the situation on the market and might update the interest rates daily before 9 a.m. (0700 GMT)," CSOB said in a statement.
"The motivation for today's change of the rates is, above all, to prevent potential speculations at the expense of the bank," the statement said.
CSOB said had confidence in measures taken by the central bank in order to calm the foreign exchange market following a sharp drop if the crown last week.

The CNB raised its last resort Lombard rate to 50 percent on Friday from previous 14 percent to avoid short-selling of the currency. It also increased the repo rate to 45 percent on Monday from 12.9 percent on Friday previous 12.4 percent.
The CNB said on Tuesday it had begun to restrict bank's access to Lombard to the extent of an unspecified portion of individual bank's capital.
The CSOB had announced a 0.3 percent increase of its prime rate to 12.02 percent on Monday, effective on Tuesday, but rescinded its decision later on Monday.
